stanza.line: Love is my sin and thy dear virtuehate
Hate of my sin grounded on sinful loving
O but with mine compare thou thine ownstate
And thou shalt find it merits not reproving
Or if it do not from those lips ofthine
That have profaned their scarlet ornaments
And sealed false bonds of love as oft asmine
Robbed others beds revenues of their rents
Be it lawful I love thee as thou lovthose
Whom thine eyes woo as mine importunethee
Root pity in thy heart that when itgrows
Thy pity may deserve to pitiedbe
If thou dost seek to have what thou dosthide
By self example mayst thou bedenied
